TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He was represented before ORG by Ms J. Starling , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr C. Whomersley of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant ’s wife died on DATE , leaving a child born in DATE . His second claim for widows’ benefits was made on DATE and was rejected on DATE on the ground that he was not entitled to widows’ benefits because he was not a woman . The applicant did not appeal as he considered or was advised that such a remedy would be bound to fail since no such social security benefits were payable to widowers under GPE law .
The domestic law relevant to this application is set out in Runkee and White v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE .
